Paul Schydlo

Curriculum Vitae Blog

Commited to making robots better team players.

Education

Instituto Superior Técnico
Integrated M.Sc. Electrical and Computer Engineering, major in Systems, Decision and Control

Research Interests

  • Machine Learning
  • Robotics
  • Human-Robot Cooperation

Recently graduated from a Master in Electrical and Computer Engineering with a major in Systems, Control and Decision theory (Robotics). In the past I worked as an undergraduate researcher in the Institute for Systems and Robotics in Lisbon and as a machine learning instructor in several venues such as the Lisbon Machine Learning School and the Data Science Starters Academy. More recently co-founding the Machine Learning Academy in Lisbon further cemented my knowledge in the field.

Wrote Master thesis on the topic of human action prediction in the context of human robot cooperation, the results of this work were published in the International Conference on Robotics and Automation and won the best national master thesis award from the Portuguese Robotics Society.

Academically, my primary focus is cognitive robotics, robotics systems that learn through, for example, modern machine learning techniques, to interact with their environment. Within cognitive robotics, I specialize in human robot cooperation and applied machine learning techniques.

Publications

"Anticipation in Human-Robot Cooperation: A Recurrent Neural Network Approach for Multiple Action Sequences Prediction", Paul Schydlo, Mirko Rakovic, Lorenzo Jamone, José Santos-Victor, Robotics and Automation (ICRA) 2018 [url]

Current Projects

  • Reinforcement Learning From Scratch: Implementation of reinforcement learning algorithms from tabular Q learning to PPO in PyTorch. Repository link TBA.
  • Human Action Anticipation Framework: Flexible Tensorflow model for learning discrete distributions over future human actions. github.com/pschydlo/ActionAnticipation
